image.altText: A group of five Indigenous men stand in a sandy, desolate area

props.synopsis: Native title holders have gathered on the banks of the Plenty River in Central Australia for a historic Federal Court decision, which will ensure they can keep culture and tradition alive on their land for generations to come.

title.children: Historic native title decision recognises exclusive possession of Huckitta Station in Central Australia

image.altText: A side-on photo of the Northern Territory Chief Minister Michael Gunner

props.synopsis: The NT's corruption watchdog makes a series of recommendations after former chief minister Michael Gunner flew to several remote communities at the cost of $14,000 to taxpayers.

title.children: NT ICAC recommends changes after chief minister's travel during 2020 election

image.altText: Young people hang around Degraves Street in Melbourne

props.synopsis: Australia is at risk of "giving up on equity" if governments fail to reform housing and tax policies to improve the economic prospects of younger generations, according to Ross Garnaut, one of the country's most respected economists.

title.children: 'Life is harder than it used to be' for young people, and this economist says that needs to change

image.altText: a dead limb of a mango tree.

props.synopsis: An agronomist says the dieback is the single biggest problem threatening the sustainability of the Darwin mango industry, especially those growing Kensington Pride mangoes.

title.children: A mystery disease is killing thousands of mango trees in the NT, putting $60m industry under threat

image.altText: Woman wearing protective face mask looks ahead next to picture of virus and vaccine injection.

props.synopsis: After a busy start to flu season, we're now bracing for new, highly transmissible COVID-causing subvariants.

title.children: Here's what you need to know about FLiRT, the new highly-transmissible COVID-causing variants

image.altText: A group of young female Israeli soldiers walk down a road, looking tired. Two are holding hands

props.synopsis: For decades, most Israelis have had to serve in the Israel Defense Forces, giving it an outsized role in Israeli society.

title.children: As war rages in Gaza, here's why Israel's military is different from other countries

image.altText: A dark-skinned man in a white T-shirt and black backpack.

props.synopsis: Up to 12 Australians who were on the London-to-Singapore flight that suffered extreme turbulence this week remain in two hospitals in Bangkok.

title.children: Three Australians in intensive care in Thai hospitals as more Singapore Airlines passengers begin journeys home

image.altText: A St John Ambulance NT vehicle driving along a road in suburban Darwin.

props.synopsis: Chief Minister Eva Lawler also says the government will provide an extra $7.8 million to the ambulance system to help it cope with demand over coming months.

title.children: NT government announces third review into St John Ambulance operations, amid pressure on service

image.altText: A composite image of a young man in black and white and an older man smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Iraklis Roussos — a pack-a-day smoker — died of lung cancer in 2019. A judge has ruled the asbestos Mr Roussos was exposed to while working on dust-choked building sites for much of his life materially contributed to his disease.

title.children: Builder's family awarded damages in asbestos lung cancer case against Amaca

image.altText: A young lady looking worried

props.synopsis: More small business owners are falling prey to online "predatory" lenders offering them quick cash. Some business owners are in such extreme financial strife that they have been forced to sell their family home.

title.children: 'Think carefully before you sign': Mia lost her family home after taking on a small business loan with $100,000 interest

image.altText: A composite image of three people.

props.synopsis: Britain's general election didn't have to be held for another six months, but Rishi Sunak's announcement to call a snap July poll might point to how desperate things have become inside his Conservative Party.

title.children: Why Rishi Sunak's surprising early election announcement is a sign he's received some 'bleak news'

image.altText: A caravan park with cars and permanent shelters set up inside.

props.synopsis: Housing providers see more people forced into "filthy, unsafe, and overpriced" caravan parks on the New South Wales Central Coast as all other affordable options dry up.

title.children: The last resort: Families living in 'filthy' caravan parks as housing crisis hits coastal towns hard

image.altText: Bailey Smith raises his eyebrows overlaid on a collage of red mullet silhouettes

props.synopsis: The ABC analyses the headshots and hairstyles of all AFL players in the 2024 season to definitively answer: is the mullet back?

title.children: The 'big boof' is out. What data reveals about football's hair trends

image.altText: A flat lay of a calculator, an electricity bill and a mobile phone displaying an ABC article about electricity prices.

props.synopsis: Embattled electricity consumers are set for modest relief after energy regulators cut benchmark power prices in most states.

title.children: Power pain to ease as regulator hands down modest price relief

image.altText: A woman in sunglasses wears a broadbrimmed hat crawling with hundreds of flies.

props.synopsis: An "absolutely shocking" number of bush flies has caught both locals and visitors to the Gascoyne off guard, with a hot summer followed by a mild autumn blamed for the outbreak.

title.children: 'Ridiculous' fly plague hits central Western Australia

image.altText: A home buyer looks at documents. In the foreground of the image is a model house and keys.

props.synopsis: Paying a mortgage is just one part of home ownership. Here are some of the other expenses to factor in.

title.children: The extra costs of home ownership that can come as a surprise

image.altText: A man wearing a black suit and blue tie

props.synopsis: Mark Latham's lawyer admits a tweet that prompted independent Sydney MP Alex Greenwich to sue the ex-One Nation NSW leader caused almost universal revulsion, but has argued it wasn't defamatory.

title.children: Mark Latham's tweet to Sydney MP was vulgar and shocking, but not defamatory, court hears

image.altText: A man in a black hood stands in front of a burnt out car

props.synopsis: The people of New Caledonia have had three referendums to vote on its independence, with the result of all three being to remain as a French territory.

title.children: Why is New Caledonia still a French territory?

image.altText: A woman wearing a helmet is escorted by two men wearing face masks outside a police station.

props.synopsis: An Australian woman currently in a Taiwanese prison charged with smuggling heroin and cocaine, initially "vehemently denied" knowing about drugs in her luggage before saying her ex-husband was behind the deal, according to court documents.

title.children: Australian mum caught with heroin at Taiwan airport blames ex-husband for drugs, police allege

image.altText: Ed Husic sitting in an ABC radio studio.

props.synopsis: Ed Husic says Peter Dutton's criticism of the International Criminal Court shows a "staggering" determination to reject a court of law, and says he has never heard concern from the Coalition about 35,000 Palestinian deaths.

title.children: Labor's Ed Husic accuses Coalition of 'incredible' disregard for Palestinian deaths

image.altText: Farmer texting on phone, dog on a ute nearby.

props.synopsis: The federal opposition had accused Labor of buying votes with the $40 million program, but the probe finds the department was "largely effective" in awarding money.

title.children: Communications minister claims vindication after probe into mobile black spot funding

image.altText: A young woman wearing spectacles looks at the camera while standing outside with ferns behind her.

props.synopsis: Cafe owner Rachel Power says her hope of benefiting from a 2023 budget promise aimed at helping small businesses has been dashed, as the bill remains stuck in parliament.

title.children: 'It's too late for me': Millions of Australians in limbo as $20,000 tax break bill stalls

image.altText: A woman with a 7 News microphone in front of her face.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson appeared via video link for the brief directions hearing, as the court prepares for her upcoming murder trial.

title.children: Accused mushroom killer Erin Patterson faces first Supreme Court hearing

image.altText: A wide shot of an old federation-era house with missing roof tiles. The sun is setting behind the Brisbane river to the right

props.synopsis: The mammoth task of restoring Lamb House to its previous brilliance went millions of dollars over budget and finished years after it was expected to. But, its owners say they have "no regrets".

title.children: 'No regrets': Owners of iconic Brisbane mansion reveal results of mammoth restoration

image.altText: A person in a white protective suit stands next to a lake holding a dead crane.

props.synopsis: Two different strains of avian influenza — also known as "bird flu" — have been detected in Victoria. Here's what to know about bird flu, its risk of transmission to humans and what precautions to take against its spread.

title.children: Two different strains of bird flu have been detected in Victoria. What do we know?

image.altText: Emmanuel Macron, wearing a black suit, walks up the steps to his Presidential plane while waiving at someone in the distance

props.synopsis: After more than a week of deadly rioting that has left six people dead, Emmanuel Macron meets with local leaders to find a way forward — but experts say the visit is unlikely to address the root causes of the unrest.

title.children: Macron lands in riot-hit New Caledonia for high-stakes talks but some say it's just a 'poker move'

image.altText: A line of people waiting to get into Graceland

props.synopsis: A judge has halted the sale of the estate, saying Graceland is part of the community and beloved around the world.

title.children: The foreclosure sale of Elvis Presley's iconic home Graceland has been halted

image.altText: A person inspects the results of breast screening.

props.synopsis: Women undergoing mammograms through SA's statewide breast screening program are being forced to wait more than twice as long as expected for results, with authorities now urgently recruiting extra radiologists to reduce delays.

title.children: Mammogram results delayed as breast screening service urgently seeks more radiologists

image.altText: A LED light spelling the letter X is seen on top of an office building at night

props.synopsis: These "superspreaders" — including the official accounts of Donald Trump Jr and the Democratic party — prove difficult for social media giants to rein in.

title.children: 'Superspreaders' are responsible for most misinformation on X — more than a third comes from just 10 people

image.altText: Rikki Hoyland takes a selfie in a car

props.synopsis: By the time she was 19, Rikki Hoyland had already been sexually assaulted twice. The Queensland youth worker represents a new generation of adolescents experiencing sexual assault at rates never seen before.

title.children: 'There's a radicalisation happening online': Fears hardcore porn could be behind rising rates of teen sexual assaults

image.altText: Signage on a store window reading "OPTUS YES"

props.synopsis: The Australian Communications and Media Authority launches legal action against Optus for allegedly failing to protect its customers' data before it was hit with a cyber attack in 2022, while the local share market is trading lower. Follow live.

title.children: Optus sued for allegedly failing to protect customers' data before cyber attack in 2022, ASX lower

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Iron ore edges lower on risk-off appetite; coking coal at two-week high
‘There’s a lot of stress out there’: Australian 2024 technical recession down to a ‘rounding error’
Call for broader reforms to prevent generational inequality from worsening

image.altText: Peter Dutton sitting in the opposition leader's char in the house of representatives

props.synopsis: As we enter the final year of the parliamentary term, pressure is growing for alternative solutions. And if the Coalition's immigration policy announcement is anything to go by, it will need to lift its game on nuclear.

title.children: Labor called the Coalition's immigration announcement an 'absolute shambles'. On nuclear, it must lift its game

image.altText: Geometric lines and shadows in entrance of building made of concrete and wood panelling.

props.synopsis: The nation's domestic spy agency says the threat facing Australia has changed since it was given the contentious powers in 2020.

title.children: ASIO says it no longer needs powers to question minors as young as 14

image.altText: A woman in a blue dress leans on a balustrade and looks out onto turquoise waters with corals.

props.synopsis: Tetepare was once home to tribes of people, before it was abruptly deserted about 200 years ago. Now, descendants are protecting it from logging and climate change.

title.children: After humans abandoned this island, it became a land outside time. Their descendants are fighting to keep it that way

image.altText: EV battery being removed

props.synopsis: More than half a billion dollars of federal government funds have been set aside to encourage production of batteries in Australia, but exactly how the scheme will work has not yet been figured out.

title.children: The national strategy to break China's stranglehold on the global battery supply chain
